text: Sylvie Becaert (born 6 September 1975 in Lille) is a French biathlete. Becaert's best year so far was 2003 when she came third in the overall world cup standings and won gold in the sprint event at the World Championships 2003 in Khanty-Mansiysk. At the 2006 Olympics in Turin, she won a bronze medal with the French relay team behind Russia and Germany. In 2009 at the World Championships in Pyeongchang, Becaert was part of the victorious mixed relay teamOfficial results from biathlonworld.com Becaert retired after the 2009–10 season. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1975 births Category:French female biathletes Category:Olympic biathletes of France Category:Olympic bronze medalists for France Category:Olympic silver medalists for France Category:Biathletes at the 2006 Winter Olympics Category:Biathletes at the 2002 Winter Olympics Category:Biathletes at the 2010 Winter Olympics Category:Living people Category:Olympic medalists in biathlon Category:Biathlon World Championships medalists Category:Medalists at the 2010 Winter Olympics Category:Medalists at the 2006 Winter Olympics Category:Université Savoie-Mont Blanc alumni
title: Sylvie Becaert
